nodes.name: Texas Data Privacy and Security Act
nodes.description: Comprehensive state consumer data privacy law that regulates the collection, use, processing, and sale of personal data of Texas residents. Grants consumers rights to access, correct, delete, and port their personal data, and to opt-out of targeted advertising, data sales, and profiling. Requires businesses to obtain consent for processing sensitive data and conduct data protection assessments for high-risk processing activities.

nodes.summary: Defines 33 key terms including 'Biometric Data', 'Dark Pattern', 'Sale', and 'Sensitive Data'.
nodes.title: Definitions

nodes.summary: Applies to entities doing business in Texas that process/sell data, unless they are a small business (SBA definition).
nodes.title: Applicability of Chapter

nodes.summary: Exempts HIPAA data, GLBA data, driver's privacy act data, and other federally regulated datasets.
nodes.title: Certain Information Exempt From Chapter

nodes.summary: Exempts state agencies, higher education institutions, and non-profits.
nodes.title: Inapplicability of Chapter

nodes.summary: States that COPPA compliance satisfies the parental consent requirements of this chapter.
nodes.title: Effect of Compliance with Parental Consent Under Federal Law

nodes.summary: Grants rights to confirm processing, correct inaccuracies, delete data, obtain a portable copy, and opt-out of sale/targeting/profiling.
nodes.title: Consumer's Personal Data Rights; Request to Exercise Rights

nodes.summary: Mandates a 45-day response window (extendable by 45 days) and requires free responses twice per year.
nodes.title: Controller Response to Consumer Request

nodes.summary: Requires controllers to establish an internal process for consumers to appeal denied requests.
nodes.title: Appeal

nodes.summary: Declares any contract provision attempting to waive these consumer rights as void and unenforceable.
nodes.title: Waiver or Limitation of Consumer Rights Prohibited

nodes.summary: Requires two secure methods for requests; mandates recognition of Universal Opt-Out Mechanisms (UOOM) by Jan 1, 2025.
nodes.title: Methods for Submitting Consumer Requests

nodes.summary: Mandates data minimization, purpose limitation, and reasonable security practices.
nodes.title: Controller Duties; Transparency

nodes.summary: Requires a clear notice including categories of data, purposes, and the specific disclosure: 'NOTICE: WE MAY SELL YOUR SENSITIVE PERSONAL DATA'.
nodes.title: Privacy Notice

nodes.summary: Requires clear and conspicuous disclosure of data sales and targeted advertising with an opt-out method.
nodes.title: Sale of Data to Third Parties and Processing for Targeted Advertising

nodes.summary: Requires processors to adhere to controller instructions and assist with security, breach notification, and DPAs.
nodes.title: Duties of Processor

nodes.summary: Mandates assessments for high-risk processing (Sale, Targeted Ads, Profiling, Sensitive Data).
nodes.title: Data Protection Assessments

nodes.summary: Requires controllers to take reasonable measures to ensure deidentified data cannot be re-identified.
nodes.title: Deidentified or Pseudonymous Data

nodes.summary: Prohibits small businesses from selling sensitive data without prior consumer consent.
nodes.title: Requirements for Small Businesses

nodes.summary: Designates the Attorney General as the sole enforcer; no private right of action for citizens.
nodes.title: Enforcement Authority Exclusive

nodes.summary: Requires the AG to maintain a website for consumer complaints.
nodes.title: Internet Website and Complaint Mechanism

nodes.summary: Clarifies that the law does not restrict complying with federal/state laws or defending legal claims.
nodes.title: Construction of Chapter

nodes.summary: or Retention of Data for Certain Purposes
nodes.title: Collection

nodes.summary: Clarifies liability when data is disclosed to third parties in compliance with the act.
nodes.title: Disclosure of Personal Data to Third Party for Certain Purposes

nodes.description: Hashed identifiers used for analytics where the salt/key is stored in a separate vault.
Temporary session tokens used for cart management, not directly linked to a user profile until login.
Mobile advertising identifiers (IDFA/GAID) where the link to PII is strictly access-controlled.
Internal customer reference numbers used in data warehouses without direct PII columns.
Telemetry data from IoT devices containing serial numbers but no owner info.
Racial or ethnic origin classification
Religious or philosophical beliefs
Medical diagnosis or health conditions
Fingerprints, facial recognition, iris scans
GPS location within 1750 feet
Data of children under 13 years old

nodes.name: Contact Information
nodes.description: Name, email, phone, mailing address

nodes.examples: Bank account ending in 1234, Annual income $75000
nodes.name: Financial Information
nodes.description: Bank accounts, credit card numbers, transaction history, income

nodes.name: Health Information
nodes.description: Medical records, prescriptions, health conditions, hospital visits

nodes.name: Biometric Data
nodes.description: Fingerprints, facial recognition, iris scan, voice patterns

nodes.examples: Last known location: 123 Main St, Current IP: 192.168.1.1
nodes.name: Location Data
nodes.description: GPS coordinates, IP address, movement tracking, home address

nodes.examples: Browsing history, Purchase history, Clickstream data
nodes.name: Behavioral Data
nodes.description: Browsing history, purchase patterns, website activity, social media

nodes.name: Government Identifiers
nodes.description: Social Security numbers, driver's license, passport

nodes.examples: Software Engineer at Tech Corp, 5 years tenure
nodes.name: Employment Information
nodes.description: Job title, employment history, salary, performance reviews

nodes.name: Educational Records
nodes.description: School records, degrees, grades, GPA, transcript

nodes.name: Professional Licenses
nodes.description: Professional certifications, licenses, credentials, memberships
Management of customer accounts and preferences
nodes.name: Customer Account Management

nodes.description: Personalized advertising based on user behavior
nodes.name: Targeted Advertising Campaigns

nodes.description: Commercial sale of personal data to brokers
nodes.name: Data Sale to Third Parties

nodes.description: Analysis of user behavior for targeting
nodes.name: Behavioral Profiling Analysis

nodes.description: Customer support and interaction logging
nodes.name: Customer Support Services

nodes.description: ML-based product recommendations
nodes.name: Product Recommendation Engine

nodes.scope_of_consent: Opt out of all data sales

nodes.recommendations: Reduce sale scope; Enhanced vendor oversight
nodes.scope_description: Sale of personal data to business partners

nodes.description: Credential compromise via phishing
Ransomware infection on server
Accidental database misconfiguration

nodes.findings_summary: Privacy notice missing appeal process; Minor data handling issues
Targeted ads DPA incomplete; Processor contract gap
nodes.focus_areas: All TDPSA requirements; Consent; DPAs; Requests

nodes.name: General Provisions
nodes.description: Defines the scope, key terms, and applicability of the law (including the Small Business exemption).

nodes.name: Consumer Personal Data Rights
nodes.description: Establishes the five core rights (Access, Correction, Deletion, Portability, Opt-Out) and the appeal process.

nodes.name: Controller and Processor Data-Related Duties and Prohibitions
nodes.description: Outlines obligations for security, privacy notices, data protection assessments, and contract requirements.

nodes.name: Enforcement
nodes.description: Grants exclusive authority to the Attorney General and establishes the 30-day cure period.

nodes.name: Construction of Chapter; Exemptions for Certain Uses
nodes.description: Provides legal safe harbors for complying with other laws (HIPAA, GLBA) and law enforcement inquiries.

nodes.scope_note: Control defined as >50% ownership or power to vote.
nodes.text: A legal entity that controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with another legal entity or shares common branding.

nodes.scope_note: Excludes physical/digital photographs, video/audio recordings, or HIPAA data.
nodes.text: Data generated by automatic measurements of an individual's biological characteristics, such as a fingerprint, voiceprint, eye retina or iris, or other unique biological pattern or characteristic that is used to identify a specific individual.

nodes.scope_note: Excludes acceptance of general terms of use, hovering/pausing content, or dark patterns.
nodes.text: A clear affirmative act signifying a consumer's freely given, specific, informed, and unambiguous agreement to process personal data relating to the consumer.

nodes.scope_note: Excludes an individual acting in a commercial or employment context.
nodes.text: An individual who is a resident of this state acting only in an individual or household context.
An individual or other person that, alone or jointly with others, determines the purpose and means of processing personal data.

nodes.scope_note: Includes practices referred to as dark patterns by the FTC.
nodes.text: A user interface designed or manipulated with the effect of substantially subverting or impairing user autonomy, decision-making, or choice.

nodes.scope_note: Includes pseudonymous data if used with linking info. Excludes deidentified data or publicly available information.
nodes.text: Any information, including sensitive data, that is linked or reasonably linkable to an identified or identifiable individual.
Information derived from technology... that directly identifies the specific location of an individual with precision and accuracy within a radius of 1,750 feet.
An operation or set of operations performed... on personal data, such as the collection, use, storage, disclosure, analysis, deletion, or modification of personal data.

Solely automated processing performed on personal data to evaluate, analyze, or predict personal aspects related to an identified or identifiable individual's economic situation, health, personal preferences, interests, reliability, behavior, location, or movements.

Any information that cannot be attributed to a specific individual without the use of additional information, provided that the additional information is kept separately and is subject to appropriate technical and organizational measures.

nodes.scope_note: Includes 'other valuable consideration' (broader than VCDPA). Exemptions: Processors, requested products, affiliates, intentional public disclosure.
nodes.text: The sharing, disclosing, or transferring of personal data for monetary or other valuable consideration by the controller to a third party.

nodes.scope_note: Requires Opt-In Consent. 'Known child' means under 13.
nodes.text: Personal data revealing racial or ethnic origin, religious beliefs, mental or physical health diagnosis, sexuality, or citizenship or immigration status; Genetic or biometric data processed for uniquely identifying an individual; Personal data collected from a known child; Precise geolocation data.

nodes.scope_note: Excludes ads based on current search, own website activity, or measuring ad performance.
nodes.text: Displaying to a consumer an advertisement that is selected based on personal data obtained from that consumer's activities over time and across nonaffiliated websites or online applications to predict the consumer's preferences or interests.

nodes.required_text: NOTICE: WE MAY SELL YOUR SENSITIVE PERSONAL DATA
NOTICE: WE MAY SELL YOUR BIOMETRIC PERSONAL DATA

nodes.condition: Sale of Personal Data OR Targeted Advertising
nodes.required_text: Clear and conspicuous disclosure of sale or targeted advertising

nodes.violation_description: Failure to include the capitalized disclosure 'NOTICE: WE MAY SELL YOUR SENSITIVE PERSONAL DATA' in the privacy policy.
Processing biometric data (facial recognition) without obtaining strict Opt-In Consent from consumers.
Website lacks a clear and conspicuous link to opt-out of targeted advertising.
Failure to recognize a valid Universal Opt-Out Mechanism (UOOM) signal sent via Global Privacy Control.
Selling personal data of a known child (age 12) without parental consent.

rels.consent_scope: Data of children under 13 years old

rels.specific_purpose_consented: Opt out of all data sales

rels.data_compromised: All personal data; Payment info; Health
